pros:
Wages 
Coworkers 
Benefits and 
Scheduling
cons: Raises are minimal at your annual review

review_title: Not that great and zero organization.
job_title: Laboratory Production Associate in Saginaw, MI
pros: The wage is fairly good for the area.
cons:
There's so much wrong that it's hard to begin. Shift time versus when the product reaches the production floor is so mismatched it's laughable. Hours of downtime and an uphill rush to get everything done in the last hour of work. 

Management wants nothing to do with the workers - we have an absolute problem of a worker creating an unsafe work environment and nothing is ever mentioned, however, miss a minor detail and they will drag you in front of everyone for a scolding. Supposedly there is a 6 week training period. I've yet to see anyone properly trained for the actual situations that are encountered on a nightly basis. 
There's never a "good job" or even an acknowledgement of getting through a tough situation. It's only ever a stick and no carrot. 

I have never received an employee handbook. Not even during the onboarding that can only be done in Grand Rapids. Seriously, it could have easily been an hour with HR (except there is no HR in Saginaw).

Better hope that you never need a blood product in the Michigan area because given the support for the workers here I'm surprised it even passes FDA guidelines.

pros:
The mission

Coworkers, mostly, are amazing people who will do anything to help

There are great leaders in place, unfortunately, they are not everywhere
cons:
People keep quitting due to unrealistic expectations, unrealistic hours, and not enough staff or resources

Extreme micromanagement by many of the executives, they need to get out of the way and let their leaders do their jobs and manage their teams

No one can stick to a plan, neverending last-minute new projects so everything is half-baked and you can't push back. Ever. If an executive mentions something, the expectation is that it gets done yesterday or replaces work in motion, even if it's a terrible idea.

job_title: Core Preparation Specialist in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Gain some experience in a laboratory setting.
cons:
Bait-and-switch with the ability to transfer when a position opens up . . . 
Not allowed to changed departments for six months AND are fully trained in current department (not mentioned in orientation) . . . 
You will never be fully trained in your department because turnover is so high (don't ask or you're "forcing trainers to train you" and will be written-up).
Personnel file WILL be destroyed so you can't transfer anyway:

HR and talent acquisition are not available due to Covid, so issues persist.
Hostile work environment from coworkers (shift blaming) and management (open threats and intimidation). 
No work/life balance. 
Unrealistic expectations (ex. doubling donated units because of Covid AND employing HALF the minimum required workers for third-shift BUT expecting production goals to be completed).
Poor leadership would be an understatement --- there is a Culture of unprofessional conduct from management with no accountability.

pros: Attempts to be and adequate employer and create an adequate work environment. If you can find reason to contiue to work here, thats good. However, if you feel that its not working out, dont feel bad for moving on.
cons:
It can be a lot of hard work and you probably will only be minimally compensated for the hard effort you put in. In the 4 + years of working there they have had a high turnover rate. Also, any improvments that they might do always felt like they were still cutting costs somehow. 

I feel like my living circumstances were very lucky in general, allowing me to live comfortably with the benefits that were provided. However, even with yearly pay increases my take home pay never changed too much do to my personal living expenses increasing yearly as well. (Things like health insurance, car loan, and contributing to retirement).

review_title: Raise the pay rate! Your employees are suffering!
pros: Easy to learn driver position.
cons: Extremely low pay for what you do. Will work you hours over your schedule. Will make you work a 3 and four man job by yourself. Stressful dealing with road rage drivers. Vehicles are not up to par and most of the driving is done on the highway and if ever in a accident I feel you wont walk away unscathed.

pros: You will get to help people

Don’t take the sign on never worked for a company that paid a sign bonus in full and expect a year out of people with pathetically low pay their cdl drivers are class b and are paid below Indy market for class b drivers by about $5 to $10 dollars. The phlebotomists are paid $3 to $5 below market. You will have to go through training and be trained by 5 to 6 people all telling you that the same thing you trained for the other trainer told you wrong. Equipment is old and could barely pas DOT inspection. If you are a green driver you will not get the proper training and they will cut you loose on your own whether you feel comfortable or not driving a large vehicle.

review_title: An Amazing Place to Work and Get a Sense of Purpose
pros: I feel fully supported by my team and am allowed room to grow professionally!
cons: I wish I could work with them in person and not virtually

pros: The mission is important and you feel a lot of pride working for the company.
cons: Overworked, understaffed due to high turnover, upper management is not competent, and very little room to grow.

pros:
-I like the company values. 
-our work saves lives.
cons:
-No Sick Time: This is a huge issue I have with the company. If you call in sick, they automatically take PTO. We work in healthcare, see lots of people, we are bound to get sick.... they’re putting patient safety at risk by having this policy. I’d rather come to work with the flu than lose my PTO, and that puts our blood supply, patients, donors, and employees at risk. 
-Can’t request off unless you have PTO in your bank. This is just ridiculous, I can’t plan my vacation a year out because I don’t have enough PTO now but will in the future. By the time I will have enough PTO in my bank, it is likely my request off will be denied because it’s first some first serve. 
-If you ask someone to work for you and your shift is covered, they automatically PTO from you even though the shift is covered.
-Hours vary by week and you need to be available 4am-10pm. 
-our benefits have decreased since becoming Versiti. For example, PTO policy is awful (see the first few bullet points), we have a PTO cap (no more acquiring PTO on overtime), and our hiring rate decreased.

pros: Somewhat good benefits, but things could be worse
cons: Pay is low. It's not like we're delivering UPS packages.

review_title: Great job for a College Student
job_title: Hospital Services Technician in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: The people here are excellent at what they do, and a delight to be around.
cons: There is little to no flexibility with the schedule.

pros: Benefits, diversity, inclusive. Jobs for all opportunities such as high school degree, college degree and masters degree
cons: Policies changing, continuously merging, benefits continually changing

pros: Definitely an organization with a mission and looks for ways to better the company constantly
cons: Hard to grow being a non profit

pros:
1. Company is growing rapidly - we now serve Wisconsin, Indiana, Illinois, Michigan and Ohio.
2. The non-profit mission is really inspiring, and services (organ and tissue procurement, blood collections, medical/physician services and research) are legitimately saving lives - which is exciting. 
3. They really invest in their leaders - providing hours of training and support 
4. My boss is awesome, she supports me, has my back and actively works to provide me with opportunities to grow and develop. I have not had this level of support in my career - and it's refreshing. 
5. No meeting Mondays - put in place to help everyone get things done on Mondays without distraction. It seems small - but it's a nice perk. 

In WI HQ - We have free parking; a delux vending machine in the breakroom; and a fun location on Marquette University's campus right across the street from a Starbucks and other restaurants.
cons:
Growing pains - 
- Some employees (especially people that have worked here for a long time) are struggling with rapid growth and change and can be vocal. 
- New work added but resources remain the same. This can be frustrating to know priorities. 
- We have outgrown our HQ! Space is limited, and departments aren't always able to sit together. 

HR is working to better define career paths at the company - once complete, that will be useful for employees just starting out to better understand how they can grow - b/c that's not always clear.

pros: Everything even the pay horrible
cons: Just a nightmare on elm street

pros: Great life saving mission being done by hard working good front line people. Benefits are average for a non-profit company. Donors and volunteers are amazing in their dedication to the mission.
cons: Pay low for entry level positions. More organization, less recreating the wheel, and major  process improvement needed in the department I worked in. Very top heavy organization while front line staff takes on the majority of the customer facing work and is grossly understaffed. Your slogan of 'doing more good than you know' does not apply to employees. No  incentives nor a positive work environment exists at corporate. Work/life balance is unrealistic if you are an exempt employee in this organization, unless you are in a leadership role.

pros: Working for an organization that contributes to the health and life of patients is beyond rewarding
cons: Top heavy management and not enough people to do the day to day work.  The idea of One Versiti is a joke.  Each location still wants to do things their own way and executive management allows this.  Poor employee retention which is costly in many ways.  Overt favoritism.  Hiring unqualified people just so the numbers look good.  Minimal mid-level management accountability for underachievers and problems.

job_title: Donor Services Specialist in Winfield, IL
pros: Versiti is a very fun, and professional place to work. I enjoy the donor base, as well as; my co-workers. I have been employed with versiti for 6 months, and I feel like i have grown a lot. I appreciate the feedback given from upper management, it really helps with confidence and techniques.
cons: I do not have any downsides other than, taking a paycut from my previous job to this one. It would have been great if they had of matched my pay, I am a mother of 5 and it is kinda hard financially.  Although, I accepted the pay-cut with the hopes of maybe growing with the company and receiving better pay than my previous job.

job_title: Strategic Sourcing Manager in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Versiti is truly a diverse organization, which includes the executive leadership team. They were one of the few companies I applied that were open to hiring an older employee. They offered very good salary and benefits not easily matched by other organizations. Although I am relatively new to the organization, everyone has been friendly, professional and positive. I have yet to meet anyone disgruntled or disenchanted with the organization. The work space is very nice and technology available is current.
cons: The interview process was very long, but I interviewed during COVID, so that could be a possible reason for the more elaborate interview process.

review_title: Great lifesaving mission, great company and great people.  The hours are never predictable.
job_title: Blood Collections/Transport Driver-Indy Mobiles in Indianapolis, IN
pros: Collecting & providing lifesaving blood donations to people in need, having fun setting up blood drives, meeting new people everyday and impacting lives of our fellow Hoosiers.
cons: Working for Indy Mobiles is like being on call.  The hours change at the blink of an eye and they are never the same day to day.  This job is extremely difficult if you have small children at home.

pros: You get your hours,centers are in nice towns they’re clean.  Great for getting experience to take your exam & learning how to draw blood.  Then get the hell out
cons: Not enough pay,your team leaders have this power trip over you if they think you aren’t kissing their butts enough & try to embarrass you in front of donors on the floor-and get away with it.  But trust me you never will.

pros: Generally a fun atmosphere while at work, decent pay, somewhat safe access to parking areas.
cons: Long hours, unstable schedule dependant on whims of marketing department. Job reviews conducted by "mentors" generally take six months to complete and are predetermined by an HR department based in Wisconsin. A rating of "above average" in any category is not possible to achieve, no matter your job performance and the driving part of your job will not be reviewed. ..at all.

review_title: It's more corporate now than ever.

Decent Pay
Insurance
cons:
Management
Too Corporate

pros: I have been here for several years and I couldn't think of a better place to work.    Coming in to work and knowing I am making a difference is life changing.    I have very good flexibility, I can be open with my ideas and feel heard and I have learned so much.
cons: I do not believe there are any for me.

review_title: Great place to make a difference
pros: Company is small enough that employees are treated like people instead of numbers. Work is meaningful and has a direct impact on the health of our community and neighbors. When issues do come up, I feel like we as employees are empowered to make meaningful changes and are supported by management to do so.  The individuals I share my day with are inspiring and a joy to work with.
cons: There is no formal work- from- home policy and with recent growth, space is extremely limited.

review_title: You Have An Impact on Your Community No Matter What Position You Hold
job_title: Talent Acquisition Specialist in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Mission - CEO - Working with teams across the region- continuous growth
cons: Anyone who doesn't do well with change, and process improvements, may feel this company moves too fast. Versiti is very much a continuous improvement environment, within the healthcare guidelines, operating in a dynamic field. Versiti will continue to evolve.

pros:
Coworkers are hard working, making progress despite challenges.
Knowledgeable management, industry wave makers.
Branch locations throughout Indy area and select cities in IN
cons:
Competition is picking up, blood usage is down through the industry.
Main Branch location is convenient to the business, but comes with safety issues.
Steady drop in employee numbers for several past years.

pros: The flexible schedule is very considerate for family. There are opportunities to acquire new knowledge and skills. Good leadership.
cons: Benefit may be improved for future.  Efficiency has been improved and initiatives have been set up to improve transparency and communication.

review_title: Comfortable living but lots of BS
pros: Competitive Salary, Friendly Coworkers, Good Benefits
cons: Lots of furloughs during COVID19, Still in the midst of standardizing from an acquisition 5 years ago. Most managers are offsite and are very disconnected from the labs needs. You feel like you have no say in process changes at your state, this is because they want to standardize across all states.

pros: Good 401k/health/dental/vision benefits. Everyone in the labs are very nice and willing to help you acclimate. Locked parking garage is nice too! I love the opportunity to learn new things everyday that will ultimately help improve the lives of patients.
cons: The training is a little overwhelming because they train on something new everyday instead of repeating the same thing until you learn it.

pros: Fantastic, diverse & enthusiastic crew! Manager listens, cares and values employees’ advice, concerns & gets to know us as individuals. Carpool vehicles provided. Rewarding work!
cons: A lot of time on the road, which can lead to 4am start - 7pm end time. Pay could be better.

pros: Great Pay. Great Mission. Served the community. Great benefits. I loved what I did and looked forward to go to the majority of the time.
cons: High turnover. HR not very supportive to discipline problematic employees and slow as molasses to get things done. Leadership very weak and disorganized. Needs more structure and strong leadership.

review_title: Saving lives with a good team
job_title: Blood Operations Specialist/Mobile Blood Drive Driver in West Bend, WI
pros:
Great work environment
Amazing co-workers that will help you succeed
Advancement opportunities
Great benefits
cons: The schedule can be a bit challenging and wearing at times.

review_title: Several benefits to the job but only if you're flexible and don't want to move up.
pros: Better compensation than most blood collection roles at other organizations.
cons: Very difficult to expand roles and move up in the company.

pros: Generous PTO allocation, ability to advance your career if you have no life outside of work
cons: Toxic culture and no work-life balance. People routinely work late into the night and through weekends. I've seen conference calls scheduled on Sunday mornings. Management is attempting to run before they walk with the acquisition of other blood banks and new ERP implementation, which has caused major headaches throughout the organization.

review_title: company don't care about their phlebotomist but work with everone else in the company

pros: very good pay, starts employees at a very high pay
cons: hours NEVER the same day to day. Company only do what's best for the company and will not work around what you need.

pros:

Coworkers 
Purpose

pros: helping patients in need through blood donation
cons: They don't care about their blood donors or volunteer coordinators. They drain their donor base.

pros: Being part of a non-profit, and seeing the benefit provided to the community is very inspiring.  You feel you are part of a team helping to change people's lives for the better.
cons: I cannot think of any cons working for Versiti.

pros: A lot of fun and fulfilling experiences on mobile phlebotomy blood drives, made some life long friends

review_title: This job is slowly going down, everyone just recieved a pay cut. Crazy hours, hard labor, not enough money to live.

cons: Physical labor and schedules. The budget cuts are also a con, $600 / week is not worth all of the troubles.

pros: Easygoing atmosphere, nice group of people, good pay, excellent company, one of the best places to work in Indianapolis, IN
cons: Wish I never left

pros: great pay, awesome team work, super donors, get to visit some amazing places, shift premiums, mileage pay, pay for addendums
